isis.stitle: POWER STEERING PUMP: EATON MODEL BB135 R, L - CLEAN AND INSPECT

svcproc.title: CLEAN AND INSPECT

step1.para: Each component except seals, should be washed in a mineral spirit solvent and air dried.
Using Figure 2 as reference, inspect each component for excessive wear in a clean and well lighted work area as follows:

step2.para: BODY/BUSHING SUB-ASSEMBLY - Inspect the shaft bushing and ball bearing bore for burring, scoring or wear condition. Replace the body/bushing sub-assembly, if necessary. The bushing is not serviceable as a separate component.

COVER/BUSHING SUB-ASSEMBLY - Inspect the shaft bushing for burring, scoring or wear condition. Replace the cover bushing sub-assembly, if necessary. The bushing is not serviceable as a separate component. Inspect the port face for excessive scoring, or pitting. Lapping or polishing of face to remove up to 0.002 inch (0.050 mm) is acceptable, taking care to maintain flat polished surface. Clean ports after refacing.

SHAFT/BALL BEARING - Inspect the shaft for any wear, burring or scoring in the areas of the bearings, seal and pulley mounting end. If any of these conditions exist, replacement is required. The ball bearing should be checked with a dial indicator for excessive wear and radial clearance. With dial indicator tip placed against bearings ( Figure 15) rotate bearing. The radial clearance should not exceed 0.010 inch (0.254 mm) maximum. Also inspect ball bearing grease seals for damage and replace bearing if necessary.

CAM - Inspect the internal surface of the cam for wear or scoring. Polish in some areas is normal. Wear severe enough to raise a noticeable burr on the I.D. corner of the cam face usually indicates replacement is required. The cam is serviced only as part of the pumping element kit.

CARRIER SHAFT ASSEMBLY - Inspect the carrier on the ends and tooth drive faces for excessive wear or scoring. If ends are worn or scored or wear pattern on any of the roll drive faces is greater than 0.06 inch (1.52 mm) in width, the carrier must be replaced. The carrier is serviced only as part of the pumping element kit.
ROLL - Inspect each of the ten rolls for pitting, scoring or wear on the O.D. surface. The rolls are serviced only as part of the pumping element kit.

PORT PLATE - Polishing and minor scratching of surface is normal due to flexible plate design. Excessive scoring or galling is not typical and can be hand polished if minor: 0.0001 inch (0.002 mm) maximum material removal allowable. Replacement is required for more severe wear.
END PLATE SEALS - The seals should not be disassembled from the plate unless cracking, excessive swelling or extrusion is present. Replace all seals if any damage is noted.
END PLATE - Inspect the end plate for cracks in the area of the sealing rings.

VALVE ASSEMBLY - It is difficult to visually determine if internal valve components are worn or damaged. If the complaint is one of low pressure, and the pumping elements show no sign of excessive wear, it is possible that valve assembly requires replacement. The valve must move smoothly in the valve bore. Minor polishing of valve O.D. up to 0.0001 inch (0.002 mm) material removal is acceptable.

svcproc.para: The above parts represent all of the parts that require inspection and possible replacement due to wear.
